curam.util.client.view

Interface ComponentRenderer<C extends Component>

  • Type Parameters:
    C - The type of component to be rendered.
    All Superinterfaces:
    PlugIn
    All Known Subinterfaces:
    DomainRenderer
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    AbstractComponentRenderer, AbstractDomainRenderer, AbstractEditRenderer, AbstractSelectRenderer, AbstractViewRenderer

    public interface ComponentRenderer<C extends Component>
extends PlugIn
    A renderer plug-in interface for components of all types.

    • Method Detail

      • render

        void render(C component,
            org.w3c.dom.DocumentFragment fragment,
            RendererContext context,
            RendererContract contract)
     throws ClientException,
            DataAccessException,
            PlugInException

        Renders a component to HTML. The HTML for the component must be appended to the given document fragment. The document fragment does not require a single root element, so several sibling elements can be added.

        Elements can be created and added to the document fragment using the standard W3C DOM Level 2 Core API. Using this API, elements must be created in the context of the appropriate document before they are added to the fragment. For example, to create a HTML input element with a type of "text" and append it to the document fragment, use the following code: 

         final org.w3c.dom.Element input;
 
 input = fragment.getOwnerDocument().createElement("input");
 input.setAttribute("type", "text");
 fragment.appendChild(input);

        Full details on the development of custom renderers are provided in the Curam Web Client Reference Manual.

        Use of the RendererContract is currently not supported in custom plug-ins.

        Parameters:
        component - The component to be rendered.
        fragment - A DOM document fragment to which to append the rendering.
        context - The context for this renderer. This can be used to resolve the paths to actual values.
        contract - The contract between this renderer and the renderer that wants to re-use it.
        Throws:
        ClientException - If the rendering fails.
        DataAccessException - If the renderer cannot access the necessary data.
        PlugInException - If the renderer cannot re-use another renderer.
